EDUCATION.Institute Name: Indraprastha Institute of Information Technology, Delhi

PROJECTS TAKEN.Description:
Developed as a part of Hardware Hackathon - Research Showcase '15, IIIT Delhi.

We used a humidity sensor to measure moisture content in the soil. We also used weather prediction data from Dark Sky Forest API, to get the probability of precipitation in the next 5 hours, on a Raspberry Pi. We used this data to decide whether the pots need water or not. This information was delivered to the pot owner using an android app.

Winning Hack of Hack InOut held in Gujrat, India.

We developed a novel way to bring the internet to the nation, without the internet. A user would call at a number provided by us, speak what he/she wants to know or do and our systems would handle the rest and return the result via an SMS.

We used a lot of technologies to build this. First of all to receive a call from the general public we needed a public phone number and an API which transfers the voice query from the phone call to our web-server. We used Exotel's API for that. Once we received the audio query, we first convert it to the default language English(en-US), then once we have the text for the query the possibility to do with it are endless, like parsing it and using various APIs like IBM Watson, Alchemy, Wolfram Alpha, Google Search, DuckDuckGo etc.

We used various methods to cluster requests into various categories using natural language processing and machine learning and make the query to the right API like Watson, Wolfram Alpha, Duck Duck Go and google maps etc. to get the best answer for the user.
